channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Abuse survivors angry at lack of change in Defence Force's 'code of silence' culture
item.description: Abuse survivors are angry - but not surprised - that problems persist in the Defence Force's culture, even after four years of Operation Respect.

item.title: People urged to stay off roads as Coromandel 'battered'
item.description: Three sections of State Highway 25 will stay shut overnight, as the eastern Coromandel Peninsula is doused by heavy rain.

item.title: Maternity services get extra $180 million, midwives in line for pay rises
item.description: Rural midwives are in line for as much as a 40 percent pay rise, with the government finally bringing more funding for the sector, and hope the boost will entice more into the job.

item.title: Counties Manukau DHB hits back at claims of a senior doctor shortage
item.description: A report claiming Counties Manukau DHB has a shortage of senior doctors and dentists is based on out-of-date data, the DHB says, and it's disappointed that it's commented on staffing levels based on old statistics.

item.title: Body found in search for Dunedin fisherman missing since last week
item.description: A body has been found in the search for a Dunedin man who went missing in Lake Wakatipu last week.

item.title: Woman charged over killing of PC Matthew Hunt named
item.description: A woman charged in relation to the death of Constable Matthew Hunt can now be named.

item.title: Auckland councillors pass 3.5% rates rise emergency budget
item.description: The budget, passed by 18 votes to 3, means cutting 1100 staff across council and services and selling council assets, and will likely be followed up with another water rates increase.

item.title: LPM breach could have revealed thousands of people's data
item.description: A design flaw in a property management firm's website meant potentially thousands of images of private customer information was publicly available.

item.title: Auckland Council may sell surplus property to patch budget gap
item.description: Auckland Council is debating whether to sell off some of its properties to help fill its $750m fiscal hole.

item.title: Christchurch gas explosion: WorkSafe files charges against two defendants
item.description: WorkSafe has filed charges following an investigation into a gas explosion in a house on Marble Court, Northwood, Christchurch in July last year.

item.title: Witness stabbed with screwdriver in synchronised armed robberies - police
item.description: Hamilton police are investigating two aggravated robberies that took place simultaneously on Tuesday evening.

item.title: M4.2 earthquake hits near Porongahau
item.description: A Magnitude 4.2 earthquake has struck in the North Island within 5km of Porongahau at a depth of 16km.

item.title: One new case of Covid-19 in managed isolation, Bloomfield confirms
item.description: Today's case is a child of two people who have both previously been reported as cases.

item.title: Wild weather closes roads in Waikato and Coromandel
item.description: Wild weather is causing problems on roads around Waikato and Coromandel.

item.title: Economist warns risk of another Covid-19 outbreak rising
item.description: An economist modelling Covid-19 cases says people should enjoy the freedoms of alert level 1 because they may not last.

item.title: Police acknowledge claim against racial bias was false
item.description: Police figures have debunked claims made by the former police commissioner that there is no racial bias when it comes to deciding whether a suspect should be charged.

item.title: Māori, Pacific and Chinese NZers less comfortable with criminal justice system - survey
item.description: Māori, Pacific and Chinese New Zealanders are less likely than others to feel their values align with the criminal justice system, according to a survey out today.

item.title: Virtual Fieldays a 'world first' for agricultural events
item.description: Fieldays was officially opened today, but this time it's online - with exhibitors, sales and video on offer for the world to see.
